originalText.text:
Sabi Sushi at The Plaza Food Hall

A medium sized counter at the Plaza Hotel that sells japanese food:  üç£sushiüêü, teriyakiüç±, and Udon.  Today i decided to try it out for the first time.  I had the udonüçú with porküê∑ dumplings.  Overall very good.  The broth is a miso based broth.  As usual with Japanese food, only a minimal amount of vegetablesüç†üåΩüçÜ.  There was a tiny bit of seaweed in the soup.  Overall though the soup was excellent! üíô

originalText.text: Food is good, though pricey for what you get. The real kicker for me, though, was the lack of kitchen hygiene. Watched one of the cooks use his cellphone between each order and then prepare food with his left hand bare. Never washed his hands. Once, watched him wipe his nose with his bare hand and went right back to preparing food. One of the grossest kitchen scenes I've had the displeasure to witness.

originalText.text: Just finished eating.  Awesome food.  Will make sure to return soon.

text.text: Just finished eating.  Awesome food.  Will make sure to return soon.

originalText.text: I had a bowl of pho here on a snowy day and for "fast" pho, it was really tasty! My only complaint is if you're going to charge $12.50 for a bowl of casual seating pho (which is about what an actual pho restaurant will charge), you should provide a slice of lime and hoisin sauce!

text.text: I had a bowl of pho here on a snowy day and for "fast" pho, it was really tasty! My only complaint is if you're going to charge $12.50 for a bowl of casual seating pho (which is about what an actual pho restaurant will charge), you should provide a slice of lime and hoisin sauce!

originalText.text: Do you want to spend 11 dollars on dry boiled skinless chicken breast with some bottled teriyaki spread thinly on it? If so, this is the perfect place!
